courses.title: Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of computer science.

courses.title: General Biology I
courses.description: This course introduces the  basic biological concepts, including cell biology, genetics, and ecology. It provides foundational knowledge for computational biology and bioinformatics.

courses.title: General Physical Chemistry
courses.description: This course introduces the fundamentals of physical chemistry, including thermodynamics, kinetics, and chemical equilibrium. Essential for computational chemistry and materials science.

courses.title: General Chemistry Practical I
courses.description: This course provides hands-on experiments in general chemistry, focusing on laboratory techniques, safety, and data analysis.

courses.title: Microsoft Office Specialist on Microsoft Office 2013 in WORD
courses.description: This course covers the introductory training in Microsoft Word for document creation, formatting, and professional communication. Prepares students for office-based roles.

courses.title: Algebra
courses.description: This course introduces the fundamental algebraic concepts and techniques, including equations, inequalities, and functions. Essential for quantitative roles.

courses.title: Trigonometry and Analytical Geometry
courses.description: This course studies trigonometric functions and analytical geometry. Provides mathematical tools for engineering and physics applications.

courses.title: Mechanics and Properties of Matter
courses.description: This course introduces basic principles of mechanics and properties of matter, including motion, forces, and energy. Foundational for physics and engineering.

courses.title: Physics Practical I
courses.description: This course provides hands-on experiments in physics, focusing on mechanics and properties of matter. Develops practical lab skills.

courses.title: Use of Library, Study Skills and Information Communication Technology I
courses.description: Introduction to library resources, study skills, and ICT tools for academic success and professional development.

courses.description: Fundamentals of effective communication in English, including writing, speaking, and presentation skills.

courses.description: This course covers basic training in Microsoft Excel for data analysis, spreadsheet management, and visualization. Prepares students for data-driven roles.

courses.description: This course covers the introductory part of computer hardware and networking, including components, configurations, and troubleshooting.

courses.title: Operating Systems I
courses.description: This course covers the introduction to operating systems, including processes, memory management, and file systems. Essential for system administration roles.

courses.description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts of differential and integral calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals. Essential for advanced mathematics.

courses.description: This course covers basic principles of electricity and magnetism, including circuits, fields, and waves. Foundational for electrical engineering

courses.description: This course covers the introduction to atomic structure and nuclear physics, including radioactivity and nuclear reactions.

courses.description: This course focuses on the study of probability distributions, including discrete and continuous distributions, and their applications.

courses.description: This course contains advanced mathematical techniques, including optimization, variational methods, and numerical linear algebra including Frobenius, Laguerre etc.

courses.title: Statistical Inference
courses.description: This course teaches the techniques for statistical inference, including estimation, hypothesis testing, and confidence intervals.

courses.description: This course focuses on creating mathematical models for real-world problems in engineering and physics including deterministic and stochastic models.

courses.description: This course covers advanced regression techniques and model diagnostics.

courses.description: This course aims to create an overview of mathematics in the industry, including applications in finance, engineering, and logistics.

courses.description: This course covers statistical methods for non-normal data distributions.

courses.description: This course is the continuation of GST211 covering scientific revolution and philosophical debates.
